meanings.definition: A narrow-mindedness or limited perspective, especially in relation to one's own group or community.
meanings.sent1: His parochialism prevented him from seeing the value in other cultures.
meanings.sent2: The mayor's parochialism made it difficult for him to consider ideas from outside the town.
meanings.sent3: The parochialism of the small town led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her parochialism was like wearing blinders, only seeing what was right in front of her.
meanings.sent5: The parochialism of the group was so strong, they couldn't even imagine life beyond their village.

meanings.definition: The practice of focusing on local or narrow concerns, often to the exclusion of broader issues.
meanings.sent1: The company's parochialism limited its growth potential.
meanings.sent2: Political parochialism can hinder progress on important national issues.
meanings.sent3: The parochialism of the committee led to some amusing debates about trivial matters.
meanings.sent4: Their parochialism was like building a fence around their minds, blocking out new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The parochialism of the team was so intense, they couldn't see the big picture.
